data.title: Organisations
data.meta_description: Welcome to the Organisations page of Mercy World - Leaders of Mercy Congregations, Institutes and Federations throughout the world.
data.text:
Mercy Organisations

Sisters of Mercy and partners-in-Mercy respond to the needs of today in a variety of ministries across the globe, providing services that are contemporary expressions of the Spiritual and Corporal Works of Mercy.

Submit an Organisation

Submit an Organisation

Thank you for your message.

Error while submitting the form. Please try again.

Enter your name and email address. We may need to contact you regarding your submission. Please double-check your email address.

Mercy Education System of the Americas

United States

Visit Website

The Mercy Education System of the Americas (MESA) is an international system of Mercy education ministries with ministries located in Argentina, Belize, Guam, Honduras, Jamaica, the Philippines, and the United States. As reflected in the first Spirit of the Institute, Mercy Education System holds in trust the ministries of MESA and places its work in the tradition of the foundress of the Sisters of Mercy, Catherine McAuley. Mercy education ministries, the ministries of MESA, though geographically diverse, share a common heritage, legacy and mission. Committed to meeting current needs Mercy education remains a vital component of the works of the Sisters of Mercy. The mission of MESA through its governance and service components upholds this commitment.

Academy of Mary Immaculate

Australia

Visit Website

The College was founded in 1857. The Academy has a rich heritage and tradition of faith, adaptability and excellence in the education of young women. Staff and students are encouraged to value this tradition and to be open to change and innovation in a spirit of Mercy  the legacy of Mother Ursula Frayne.

Read More

Academy of Our Lady of Mercy - Lauralton Hall

Milford, Connecticut

Visit Website

Founded in 1905 by the Sisters of Mercy, Lauralton Hall is the first Catholic college-preparatory high school for girls in Connecticut and among the first established in the United States. Today, we live at the intersection of tradition and innovation.

Adderton: house & heart of mercy

Australia

Visit Website

Overlooking the Brisbane (Queensland) River, Addertonrenamed in 1863 as the Convent of Our Lady of Mercy, All Hallows (All Hallows Convent)has been at the heart of the Sisters of Mercys work in Brisbane since 1863. Situated within the former All Hallows Convent, Adderton: house & heart of mercy will open to visitors in 2018. A new program of events and exhibitions will introduce visitors to Mercy history and the legacy of this unique Brisbane landmark. The rejuvenated Adderton: house & heart of mercy will be a multi-use art, exhibition and ideas space grounded in the Mercy values of creativity, diversity and inclusiveness.

Aiseiri Cahir

Ireland

Visit Website

With 25 years experience in the treatment field in Ireland Aisir has made a significant contribution to recovery from addiction.

Read More

All Hallows School

Australia

Visit Website

ll Hallows' School was founded by the Sisters of Mercy in 1861. All Hallows School is a Catholic girls school within the educational and spiritual tradition of the Sisters of Mercy. Our inspirations are Jesus Christ, Gospel values and the life and faith of Catherine McAuley. Our community works to nurture and challenge our students within a dynamic and holistic learning environment. We educate young women in readiness to embrace their future with confidence and self-knowledge so as to live Gospel values.

All-Africa Conference: Sister to Sister

New Jersey

Visit Website

All-Africa Conference: Sister to Sister (AACSS) is a process to empower women to more effectively address HIV/AIDS issues and to bring new information and hope to every village and hut in sub-Saharan Africa.

Alpha Infant School

Jamaica

Visit Website

Alpha Infant School opened its doors on August 4, 1986, with four children and one Sister of Mercy. Today, over 350 students ages 4 to 6 are enrolled at the institution. Alpha Infant School endeavors through its academic and core curricula programs to provide quality education for its students; to equip them with skills, values, attitudes and knowledge; to facilitate a sense of pride and commitment to the advancement of self, in order to begin the next phase of development; to enable them to be critical thinkers; and too teach them to live as worthwhile individuals in the immediate and wider community.

Alpha Institute

Jamaica

Visit Website

Alpha Institute provides a caring and committed environment to youth in need of educational, vocational and life skills training. Founded in 1882, today Alpha Institute serves 100 young men ages 16 to 18.

Alpha Primary School

Jamaica

Alpha Primary School has been serving children in grades first through sixth since 1895. The school has over 1000 enrolled students. Alpha Primary School has remained one of Jamaicas premier institutions over the years, boasting outstanding results in all national standardised examinations.

Aquinas College

Ashmore, Queensland

Visit Website

Aquinas College originated from a perceived need of the Guardian Angels Parish Community and developed through the support of the Vincentian Fathers along with the dedicated service of the Christian Brothers of Aquinas College and the Sisters of Mercy of Star of the Sea College.

Aranmore Catholic College

Leederville, Western Australia

Visit Website

Aranmore strives with Christ as the foundation, to create a learning environment which fosters: Openness, Quality of Relating, Growth in freedom and responsibility, and Reflective and Critical Thinking

Ardscoil Mhuire Corbally

Limerick, Ireland

Visit Website

Ardscoil Mhuire is an all girls voluntary secondary school under the trusteeship of the Sisters of Mercy.

We provide a Catholic education aimed of fostering the pupils intellectual, human, cultural, and spiritual potential to the maximum, enabling them to develop as mature, responsible individuals.

Assumption High School

Louisville, Kentucky

Visit Website

Established in 1955 by the Sisters of Mercy, Assumption is a private, Catholic secondary school for young women. The education at Assumption offers students the finest academic programs, experiences of a Christian community and opportunities to grow in faith.

Building Healthier Communities

Silver Spring, Maryland

Works with community and faith-based organizations involved in housing, health care, education, economic development and human services to collaborate to revitalize communities and address related public policy issues.

Bunbury Catholic College

Australia

Visit Website

The formation of Bunbury Catholic College took place in 1973 with the amalgamation of the Marist Brothers St Francis Xaviers boys school and the Mercy Sisters St Josephs girls school.

Carlow University

United States

Visit Website

Located in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, Carlow University was founded by the Sisters of Mercy in 1929. Offering both undergraduate and graduate programs, Carlow University is a comprehensive master's institution dedicated to learner-centered education at the collegiate levels and at the elementary school level in the Campus School of Carlow University.

Carmel College

Auckland, New Zealand

Visit Website

An integrated Catholic secondary school for girls from Years 7 to 13, located on Auckland's North Shore.

Catherine House Inc.

Australia

Visit Website

Established in 1988 by the Sisters of Mercy, Catherine House Inc. is the only provider of supported accommodation in South Australia for women over 21 years and unaccompanied by children.

Read More

Catherine McAuley Center

Cedar Rapids, Iowa

Visit Website

Founded in 1989 by the Sisters of Mercy and community friends, the Center provides two distinct programs: A transitional housing program to provide unaccompanied women with a safe place to live. An adult basic education program to guide and improve the lives of both women and men.

Catherine McAuley College

Australia

Visit Website

Catherine McAuley College has a proud tradition of Catholic education dating back to 1876 when Sister Aloysius Martyn and the Sisters of Mercy first arrived in Bendigo. For over 140 years, the Sisters of Mercy have given extraordinary service to the Bendigo community. Inspired by their foundress, Catherine McAuley, the Sisters have educated thousands of children and worked tirelessly wherever their help was needed.

Catherine McAuley High School

Westmead, NSW

Visit Website

We value our Mercy tradition, our sense of community, our focus on the future, our respect for the uniqueness of the individual and our attention to the education of the whole person.

Catherine's Legacy

Afghanistan

Visit Website

Catherines Legacy designs and creates a wide-variety of cards suitable for and customizable to any occasion! For professional artist Sister of Mercy Judy Ward rsm, creating your one-of-a-kind design is a joy for her to accommodate your every printed need.

Colaiste Muire

Ennis, Co. Clare, Ireland

Visit Website

Coliste Muire is under the trusteeship of CEIST, which means Catholic Education and Irish Schools Trust. The aim of CEIST is to continue to nurture and support the Catholic ethos of Coliste Muire and other similar schools so that a values-based education can continue to be available to parents and young people in the Irish educational system.

Colegio Santa Ethnea

Argentina

Visit Website

Familia de Familias... En mision tras las huellas de la Misericordia.

Collaborative Center for Justice

United States

Visit Website

The Collaborative Center for Justice, initiated in January, 1999, is sponsored by five Religious Congregations of Women in Connecticut: Daughters of the Holy Spirit, Sisters of St. Joseph of Chambery, Daughters of Mary of the Immaculate Conception, Sisters of Mercy of the Americas, Sisters of Notre Dame de Namur. Other Religious Congregations contributing to the support of the Center are: Daughters of Wisdom, Congregation de Notre Dame, School Sisters of Notre Dame. These Congregations represent almost one thousand women religious and associates in Connecticut.

College Misericordia

Dallas, Texas

Visit Website

An undergraduate/graduate, co-ed, Catholic, private liberal arts college in PA.

College of Saint Mary

Omaha, Nebraska

Visit Website

College of Saint Mary is a pioneer in the careful education of women. Since our founding by the Sisters of Mercy in 1923, women of all faiths, from all parts of the world and from diverse backgrounds have studied education, the arts, sciences, business and health care professions.

Conference for Mercy Higher Education

United States

Visit Website

Our mission is the preservation and development of the core Catholic identity of Mercy higher education in accord with the spirit, mission, and heritage of the Sisters of Mercy.

Convent of Mercy Academy

Jamaica

Visit Website

Convent of Mercy Academy strives to instill in all our students those educational, cultural and spiritual values which will enable them to contribute to the economic development of Jamaican society and to minister to the welfare of the poor, sick and uneducated in our midst and thereby continue the mission of Jesus. This all-girls schools serves 100 students in grades 7 to 11.

Cranaleith Spiritual Center

United States

Visit Website

One of the most significant gifts we have as humans is our yearning for meaning, purpose and fullness of life. But this desire  our very spirit  can be crushed or numbed by poverty, illness, violence, trauma, misfortune or the pressures of home life or work. Cranaleith Spiritual Center is a place of respite that fosters contemplation, reflection, discernment and, ultimately, transformation for those who come.

Read More

Cristo Rey Sacramento High School

United States

Visit Website

Cristo Rey High School is a unique high school that provides an affordable, Catholic, college preparatory education to students from low-income families in Sacramento.

Damascus College

Ballarat East, Victoria

Visit Website

Our history and tradition stretches over 100 years and we have been an integral part of the rural city of Ballarat and surrounding areas serving students over a 50 km radius and some from overseas.

Earthlink

Australia

Visit Website

Why Earth Link? Earth Link provides an opportunity for people who are concerned about the future of Earth to reflect on their concern and move towards action. Earth Link has a particular emphasis on why we need to care for Earth, and also on the importance of beginning with our place, and then extending our concern outwards to regional and global concerns.

Who will benefit? People of all ages who are concerned about the future of Earth, including parents, grandparents, educators, helping professionals, environmentalists. Earth Link will be of special benefit to those who are interested in ecospirituality and sustainable living.

Fraynework Multimedia

Australia

Visit Website

Fraynework is a not for profit organisation established to create multimedia productions which promote greater understanding between peoples and which contribute to the development of a more just and compassionate world. We assist people to tell their stories in clear, compelling, informative and engaging ways through rich media and the interactivity of digital formats. We call this 'digital story telling'.

The supportive vision and ownership of Fraynework belongs to the Sisters of Mercy in Melbourne, Australia who see this work as a continuation of their 175 years of engagement in more traditional forms of education throughout the world; in higher education, secondary and primary schools, training facilities, adult education centres and kindergarten.

Galilee Community

Ireland

Visit Website

Galilee Community is a sacred space, a place of prayer, reflection and sacred landscapes that draw the human spirit to find God present in all life experiences.

Read More

Georgian Court College - Lakewood

Lakewood, New Jersey

Visit Website

A Catholic, four year liberal arts college open to students of all faiths. While the day division is a women's college, Georgian Court College also offers a co-educational evening division and a co-educational graduate school.

Gwynedd Mercy Academy High School

United States

Visit Website

Gwynedd Mercy Academy High School, a Catholic college-preparatory school, encourages young women to live and act justly in the spirit of Jesus Christ and to follow in the tradition of mercy and service inherited from Catherine McAuley. Educating, empowering, and inspiring young women in grades 9 thru 12, the Academy is located in suburban Montgomery County, 20 miles northwest of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and is adjacent to the campus of Gwynedd Mercy University

Gwynedd-Mercy Academy Elementary

United States

Visit Website

Gwynedd-Mercy Academy is a private, Catholic, academy for boys and girls in Pennsylvania, committed to quality education integrated with Gospel values. A ministry established by the Sisters of Mercy in 1861, and sponsored by the Mercy Education System of the Americas (MESA), Gwynedd-Mercy Academy combines a long tradition of academic excellence with innovative teaching methodology and progressive technology integration to create a caring, child-centered environment

Gwynedd-Mercy College

Gwynedd Valley, Pennsylvania

Visit Website

Education is a life-long process that enriches the intellectual, moral and spiritual life of the individual and prepares him/her for an active role in society.

Holy Cross High School

Philippines

Holy Cross High School is a private diocesan Catholic school managed by the Sisters of Mercy. The spirit and charism of Catherine McAuley and legacy to Mercy education are kept alive in the school's mission, vision, goals and objectives. Special care for the restoration of Mother Earth, peace education and leadership training are important aspects of education at the school.

Holy Family Senior School

Ireland

Visit Website

Holy Family Senior School Ennis, Co. Clare Ireland

House of Mercy

United States

Visit Website

A family care home licensed by the North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services, is able to serve a capacity of six residents in a home setting.

Read More

Infant of Prague Catholic Nursery and Kindergarten

Guam

Infant of Prague Catholic Nursery and Kindergarten is a daycare facility under the leadership of the Sisters of Mercy. The current enrollment capacity is 275 children. This facility accepts children from three months old to five years of age.

Institute of Law and Religious Life

Dallas, Texas

Visit Website

For those in leadership in Roman Catholic religious congregations whether preparing for leadership, newly elected, or well-seasoned, the Institute offers professional development in pragmatic and practical information in the areas of canon and civil law.

MUCEC

Panama

Visit Website

MUCEC was founded by the Sisters of Mercy in 1985 in an effort to help some of the poorest of Colons impoverished inhabitants - the abused women and their children with little or no income.

Read More

MacKillop Family Services

Australia

Visit Website

MacKillop Family Services provides a wide range of programs for disadvantaged children, young people and families in both Melbourne and Geelong.

MacKillop Family Services was established in 1997 to continue the services to children, young people and families previously undertaken by agencies established by the Sisters of Mercy, the Christian Brothers, and the Sisters of St Joseph.

Marist Regional College

Burnie, Tasmania

Visit Website

This year 7-12 co-educational secondary school, with approximately 700 students, was founded in 1972 from the amalgamation of Stella Maris Regional College run by the Sisters of Mercy, and Marist College run by the Marist Fathers.

Mary Immaculate Secondary School

Lisdoonvarna, Co.Clare, Ireland

Visit Website

At Mary Immaculate Secondary School, we know what it takes to enhance our students education. Our unique approach to learning makes Mary Immaculate Secondary School more than just a physical School - its a life experience.

Mary Wickham Poetry and Spirituality

Australia

Visit Website

The website of Mary Wickham's prayers, poetry and other writing. Themes of interest include Mercy and Celtic Spirituality, the disadvantaged and dementia and exploring spirituality in the contemporary world.

Mater Christi School

Burlington, Vermont

Visit Website

A private Catholic school, sponsored by the Sisters of Mercy. We welcome students from families of all denominations in Pre-School through Grade 8.

Mater Health Services

Australia

Visit Website

Through a network of healthcare resources featuring seven hospitals, more than 4,000 staff and a commitment to excellence, Mater Health Services provides care for some half-a-million people each year.

The Mater was established in 1906 by the Sisters of Mercy. In 2002, Mater Health Services became an incorporated body, charged with the responsibility to continue the Mission of the Sisters of Mercy to offer compassionate service to the sick and needy.

Mater Hospital

Kenya

Visit Website

The Mater Hospital was opened in 1962 by the Sisters of Mercy, a Catholic Order of Nuns originating from Ireland.

Read More

Mater Private Hospital

Dublin, Ireland

Visit Website

To continue the healing mission of Christ by providing the highest quality healthcare in an independent tertiary acute care facility, complementary to the services provided by the Mater Misericordiae Hospital

McAuley High School NZ

Auckland, New Zealand

Visit Website

McAuley High School was founded by the Sisters of Mercy, and we still walk proudly in the Mercy tradition. McAuley students are from multicultural backgrounds, and we rejoice in our diversity.

McAuley Images

United States

Visit Website

Although art has always been a significant part of Marie Henderson's life, it was not until attending Mercy High School in Detroit, MI, that her association with Sister Mary Ignatius Denay, RSM, gave her the impetus to pursue and develop her talent. A few years prior to entering the Sisters of Mercy, in 1985, her artwork began to focus on Catherine McAuley, the first Sister of Mercy.

McAuley Ministries

United States

Visit Website

Named in honor of Catherine McAuley, founder of the Sisters of Mercy, McAuley Ministries is the grant-making foundation of Pittsburgh Mercy. McAuley Ministries, which is celebrating 15 years of grant-making in 2024, serves as a catalyst for change, committing resources and working collaboratively to promote healthy, safe, and vibrant communities. Grant-making priorities include capacity building, education, empowerment, environmental care, essential needs and social services, peacemaking, and whole-person health initiatives for nonprofit organizations which focus on the Hill District, Uptown, and West Oakland, the three Pittsburgh communities historically served by the Sisters of Mercy. McAuley Ministries also provides support to organizations in Southwestern Pennsylvania that are sponsored by the Sisters. Since its founding by the Sisters of Mercy in 2008, McAuley Ministries has awarded 975 grants and community support totaling over $56 million. It awards on average $3.5 million in grants annually, making it one of the largest philanthropic foundations in Southwestern Pennsylvania. To learn more about McAuley Ministries and the initiatives it supports, visit our website, www.mcauleyministries.org. We invite you to follow us on Facebook and LinkedIn.

Read More

Mercedes College

Perth, Western Australia

Visit Website

The College has a long and proud tradition of academic and sporting excellence. It has a strong focus on the arts with drama performances occuring each year, the orchestra and choir participating in many musical events, and the art exhibition being an important annual event.

Mercedes College Springfield

Springfield, South Australia

Visit Website

Founded in 1954 by the Sisters of Mercy, Mercedes College is situated on a beautiful six hectare site in the Adelaide foothills, just seven kilometres from the city centre, and conveniently located on major transport routes.

Mercy Academy

United States

Visit Website

Mercy Academy helps each student nourish her faith and strengthen her Christian values. Our goal is for each student to become a woman of Mercy, beautifully expressed in the Mercy Creed as:

A woman rooted in the values of Jesus

A woman well educated and self-disciplined

A woman compassionate and generous

A woman able to lead and willing to serve

who graciously shares these Mercy values with others.

Mercy Associates - in England, Scotland and Wales

United Kingdom

Visit Website

News and information about Mercy Associates in England, Scotland and Wales.

Mercy Care

United States

Visit Website

Mercy Care is a community health center with a network of 11 primary care and behavioral health clinics that serve the uninsured and underinsured across Atlanta, Georgia.

Read More

Mercy Career and Technical High School

Philadelphia, United States

Visit Website

Mercy Career & Technical High School (Mercy CTE) provides an immersive, project-based education to prepare students for whats next, whether it be entering the workforce to start a career or continuing their education after graduation. Founded in 1950, the school is deeply rooted in the Catholic faith and the mission of the Sisters of Mercy, backed by a legacy of proven success. Mercy CTE prepares students for rewarding careers and instills life-long value for its graduates. Nurturing and empowering the whole individual, Mercy CTE opens doors and creates opportunities, providing contemporary job options and a non-traditional path to higher education.

Mercy Catholic College

Chatswood, Australia

Visit Website

A year seven to twelve girls catholic college founded in the tradition of the Sisters of Mercy and Catherine McAuley.

Mercy Center Bronx NY

Bronx, NY

Visit Website

Mercy Center is a nonsectarian center for parents in the Mott Haven section of the South Bronx. Its mission is to provide educational, technical, human and supportive services to women, parents and other family members enabling them to become empowered to reach their full human potential, lead meaningful lives, and be agents of change in their families and communities.

Mercy Center at Madison

Madison, Connecticut

Visit Website

Waves lapping the shore . . . towering trees shading the path . . . deep quiet punctuated only by the rustle of leaves, a coastal breeze and the birds and animals who live nearby. Its these 38 acres of natural beauty that enable Mercy Center to offer such a uniquely hospitable space for exploration of the human spirit in all its fullness.

Join us on your own or with a special someone, for a scheduled program or simply for time away. Or bring a group to which you belong for an offsite meeting that requires a different kind of space. Come for an evening, a day, a weekend or a longer retreat or sabbatical.

Mercy Center for Women

Pennsylvania

Visit Website

Mercy Center for Women (MCW) was founded by the sisters of Mercy in January 1994 to provide long term (up to 1 year) transitional housing and support services to homeless women with or without children. MCW was founded by combining the services of two agencies, Hope House, an emergency shelter for women and children, and Grass Roots Opportunities for Women, an advocacy center.

Mercy Center on Aging

Pennsylvania

Visit Website

The Mercy Center on Aging (Erie Pennsylvania) provides a focal point where older persons can come together for a variety of activities, services, and programs. It is intended that all of the community's ethnic, religous, and racial groups will feel welcome and combfortable. At the Center, the older person is encouraged to remain independent and relate to others in a setting that is his/her own.

Mercy Centre New Jersey

United States

Visit Website

Mercy Center, founded and sponsored by the Sisters of Mercy of New Jersey, is a comprehensive social service and educational agency, which provides hope, help and healing within our community.

Mercy Centre for Ecology and Justice

St. Johns, Newfoundland and Labrador

Visit Website

The Mercy Centre for Ecology and Justice is guided by five principles central to promoting our mission.

The focus of ecology and justice embraces the interconnectedness and interrelatedness of God, self, others and Earth.

The mission of MCEJ is grounded in the Gospel values of justice and equality.

The mandate is guided by relevant justice and ecology resources (i.e.Social Teachings of the Catholic Church and the Earth Charter).

Collaboration with international, national and local networks is central to our work.

The involvement of youth is essential in the work of ecology and justice.

Mercy College

Mirrabooka, Western Australia

Visit Website

Our aim is to offer a Christian education, which will provide for the spiritual, intellectual, physical, emotional and social needs of our students.

Mercy College

Coburg, Australia

Visit Website

Mercy College is a Catholic Secondary College catering for the young women of the northern suburbs of Melbourne. Established in 1965, it now has 750 students.

Our vision of education at Mercy College is inspired by the values enshrined in the Gospels: love, service, and justice; and the Mercy tradition of striving for excellence within an environment of compassion and caring for students and their families.

Mercy College of Health Sciences

Des Moines, Iowa

Visit Website

A health-system-affiliated, Catholic institution of higher education. Guided by the core values of the Spirit of Mercy - compassion, hospitality, excellence, stewardship, and dignity of the individual -the primary purpose of the College is to prepare students for service and leadership roles in health care.

Mercy Connect

Australia

Visit Website

At Mercy Connect, we provide a range of services to support adults, children and older people with a disability to live independently and get actively involved in their community.

Sponsored by the Institute of the Sisters of Mercy of Australia & Papua New Guinea (ISMAPNG), we are a not-for-profit Catholic organisation, delivering programs registered under the NDIS. Our programs support people with disability to build skills and capability to ensure they can participate in leading a meaningful life.

We have a service area spanning across the Riverina/Murray, Central West and New England areas of New South Wales.

Mercy Continuing Care

United States

Visit Website

Drawing on the strength and support of Mercy's integrated health system, Mercy Continuing Care has become a widely recognized innovator in providing a comprehensive spectrum of services that focuses specifically on the special needs of seniors.

Mercy Crest

United States

Visit Website

Mercy crest offers assisted living, retirement center, residential care facilities, seniors retirement living, seniors apartments, assisted living center, independent living, continuing care retirement, assisted living facilities, adult independent apartments, senior retirement living services.

Mercy Ecocommunications

Carlton North, Victoria, Australia

Visit Website

Constantly developing a clearer understanding of the ecological challenges of our time is a unifying energy for all those who want to respond to the cry of Earth and the cries of the Poorest

This web site provide access to some reflective resources and sharing spaces on these themes.

The vision for EcoCommunications is based on the sharing of the good news of the Gospel inspired by the challenging words of Pope Francis in Laudato Si.

Mercy Ecology

Cumberland, Rhode island USA

Visit Website

Our mission is to inspire reverence for Earth and to work towards sustainability of life by acting in harmony with all creation.

Mercy Family Services

Queensland, Australia

Visit Website

Sponsored by the Brisbane Congregation of the Sisters of Mercy, our organisation was formed in 1996 following the amalgamation of three formerly separate Sisters of Mercy programs providing services for children and young people at St Vincents, Nudgee; Fatima, Toowoomba and The Peace Centre, Goodna. Since that time, we have focused on building a strong identity, promoting community relationships and strengthening partnerships with funding bodies to enable the delivery of high-quality services to clients.

Mercy Farm

Benson Vermont, USA

Visit Website

We call Mercy Farm an eco-spiritual center because coming to know our relationship with nature is a spiritual practice  one that interacts with all of our senses. Spiritual practice invites us to contemplate and engage in the world in an intentional way that is dedicated to developing a more insightful, mature relationship with self and the world  a way that is profoundly meaningful and fulfilling. We invite you to come to Mercy Farm to be engaged, to observe and contemplate what this space has to offer.

Mercy Foundation

Australia

Visit Website

The Mercy Foundation is an organisation committed to social justice and structural change with the goal of creating greater social equity and inclusion in the Australian community. The Mercy Foundation addresses its social justice agenda through seed funding, advocacy and education.

Mercy General Health Partners

Muskegon, Michigan

Visit Website

MGHP provides a wide range of primary care and specialty services on two campuses. Mercy General Health Partners is the largest healthcare provider in the area and is a referral hospital for many surrounding communities.

Mercy Haven

New York, United States

Visit Website

Mercy Haven was begun by a small group of people who decided to make a difference by responding to the dire need they recognized for housing and advocacy among people in their community.

The result of those seeds sown in 1985 is what we would like to share. But reading about our program is only one way to appreciate it. We encourage you to come and visit our residents and let them speak for themselves.

Mercy Health & Aged Care

Australia

Visit Website

As well as being our identifying characteristic, mercy is the source of energy that sustains and directs all the activities of the facilities and enables the healing and wellbeing of our patients and residents.

Mercy Health System

Conshohocken, Pennsylvania

Visit Website

Caring people who touch lives throughout the region, committed to providing quality, compassionate health care services.

Mercy Heights Catholic Nursery & Kindergarten

Tamuning, Guyana

Mercy High School

San Francisco, United States

Visit Website

Mercy High School, San Francisco, educates women to pursue lives of spiritual and intellectual depth, determination and daring action to improve our world as an inclusive, Catholic, college preparatory community enlivened by the gospel of Jesus and the charism of the Sisters of Mercy.

Mercy High School Baltimore

Baltimore, Maryland

Visit Website

Mercy High School is a private Catholic secondary school for young women sponsored by the Sisters of Mercy, Baltimore Regional Community. Its mission is to offer students a superior college preparatory education in an environment rooted in Christian values.

Mercy High School Burlingame

Burlingame, California

Visit Website

Dedicated to educating young women of all cultural and economic backgrounds for academic excellence, compassionate service, Christian leadership, global awareness, and life long learning.

Mercy High School Farmington Hills

Farmington Hills, Michigan

Visit Website

The common thread among staff, students and parents is a commitment to academic excellence, cultural diversity and the integration of Mercy Values into daily life.

Mercy High School Middletown

Middletown, Connecticut

Visit Website

Educating Today's Young Women in a Spiritual Community.

Mercy High School Omaha

Omaha, Nebraska

Visit Website

In addition to complete college preparatory offerings, Mercy's extensive curriculum includes a full range of fine arts, business, career and general education offerings.

Mercy Home for Children

Brooklyn, NY

Visit Website

Founded in 1865, Mercy Home offers care and professional services for young people with severe developmental disabilities. We provide these services in intermediate care facilities throughout the city.

Mercy Hospice

New Zealand

Visit Website

Mercy Hospice Auckland was established by the Sisters of Mercy. Led by Sister Cecilia Maher, the Sisters of Mercy first came to New Zealand at the invitation of local Maori women.

Read More

Mercy Hospital Dunedin

Aotearoa New Zealand

Visit Website

Mercy Hospital is a private not-for-profit organisation with charitable status.

The organisation is owned by Nga Whaea Atawhai o Aotearoa Sisters of Mercy New Zealand. The hospital was established in 1936 and relocated to the current Maori Hill site in 1969. Our main focus is private elective surgery with six theatres, a two bed ICU facility, forty-one inpatient beds, twenty-four day surgery beds, six day surgery chairs along with a fully equipped Cardiac Catheterisation Lab.

Mercy Housing

Denver Colorado

Visit Website

Mercy Housing is a national organization that acquires and dev elops program-enriched housing for a variety of low-income populations, including families, seniors and people with special needs.

Read More

Mercy Hub

Australia

Visit Website

Mercy Hub provides a Community space to gather, learn and grow. It is a gathering space, a meeting place, a work space, a prayer place where hospitality and mercy are present. The logo and the doors of Mercy Hub capture and state the heart and purpose of what we are about together: Mission, Action and Spirituality

Mercy Junior College

Mindanao, Philippines

Mercy Law Resource Centre

Ireland

Visit Website

Mercy Law Resource Centre is an independent law centre set up by the Sisters of Mercy in 2009. It provides a free, quality and holistic legal service to those who are homeless/at risk of becoming so.

Read More

Mercy McAuley High School

Cincinnati, United States

Visit Website

Mercyhurst University is an accredited, four-year, Catholic institution founded in 1926 by the Sisters of Mercy. Located in Erie, Pennsylvania, on a hill overlooking Lake Erie, our 75-acre campus is known as one of the most beautiful in the region. Elements of English Gothic architecture are carried throughout our Old Main, academic buildings and student residence halls. Grounded in the ideals of service, hospitality and entrepreneurship that inspired our founders, a Mercyhurst education encourages the development of lifelong passions and engagement with the larger world. Inspired by our motto, Carpe Diem, our faculty and students embrace innovation and leadership in service, as they make a difference within our gates and around the world.

Pittsburgh Mercy

United States

Visit Website

Pittsburgh Mercy is one of the largest community health and social service providers and employers in Southwestern Pennsylvania. We offer help  and hope  to our communitys most vulnerable:

People who have complex behavioral and physical health challenges.

People who have intellectual and developmental disabilities

People who are experiencing homelessness

People who need wrap-around services to live safe, healthy, and well in the community.

We serve more than 18,000 people annually in 60+ locations. We are the largest Integrated Community Wellness Center (ICWC) in Pennsylvania and the only ICWC in Southwestern Pennsylvania. We are a five-time awardee of Substance Abuse & Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) Certified Community Behavioral Health Center (CCBHC) expansion grants. Pittsburgh Mercy is a member of Trinity Health serving in the tradition of the Sisters of Mercy. Our mission is to be a compassionate and transforming, healing presence within our communities. To learn more about Pittsburgh Mercy or to make a donation in support of its important work in the community, please visit www.pittsburghmercy.org. We invite you to follow us on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and X (formerly known as Twitter)

Sisters of Mercy Urgent Care's Catherine McAuley Mercy Foundation

United States

Visit Website

Catherine McAuley Mercy Foundation supports Sisters of Mercy Urgent Care which provides care for non-life-threatening illnesses and injuries, as well as sending medical mission teams to Haiti.

The Sisters of Mercy have been serving Western North Carolina since 1900, evolving to meet the needs of the time like Foundress Catherine McAuley. Catherine McAuley Mercy Foundation is the fundraising arm of Sisters of Mercy Urgent Care which provides care for non-life-threatening illnesses and injuries, 7 days a week, 362 days year (closed on Easter, Thanksgiving, and Christmas) without an appointment, at a fraction of the time and cost of an emergency room visit. The not-for-profit urgent care facilities provide an average of $1.5 million in uncompensated care annually and have treated more than 1 million patients since their 1985 inception. In addition, Catherine McAuley Mercy Foundation has supported sending medical teams from Sisters of Mercy Urgent Care to serve in Haiti since the 2010 earthquake. The most recent team in February 2013, cared for 1,079 patients in 5 days! Mercy staff also raised over $35,000 in 2012 to purchase a four-wheel-drive vehicle for the Haitian physicians use in reaching those suffering in the outlying areas of Haiti.

St. Leos College

Co. Carlow, Ireland

Visit Website

St. Leos College, Carlow opened its doors to the first students on1st May 1839. It was named after St. Leo on whose feast day, 11th April, the Sisters of Mercy arrived in Carlow. The school building was part of the convent, and the sense of urgency in providing a centre of education was so great that the school section was completed before the sisters accommodation. The present community/living room was the first school. In this one large room the students were organised in little groups. It was the first second-level Mercy school. Today it is a fine complex with close on 850 students.

The Congregation of the Sisters of Mercy

Ireland

Visit Website

The Congregation of the Sisters of Mercy (Ireland) was formed in 1994. At that time 26 separate units of the Mercy family in Ireland, (with a tradition of being autonomous at diocesan level) and the Sisters of Mercy in South Africa came together to form one Congregation in order to be more effective in Mercy mission. The Congregation consists of seven provinces, three regions and three mission areas. At present there are just over 2770 members with communities in Peru, South Africa, United States, Kenya, Zambia, Nigeria, Brazil, British Columbia, England

Women@thewell provides a creative and supportive space for vulnerable women based on Gospel values and developing a holistic response to their needs.

Women of Colon Walking Together (MUCEC)

Colon, Republic of Panama

Visit Website

MUCEC was founded in Colon, Panama 15 years ago by the Sisters of Mercy to enable poor and abused women and their children to help themselves to become productive citizens. MUCEC aims to teach self-confidence and useful skills and to instill belief and hope that a better quality of life is possible for even the less fortunate.

mercyFirst

Syosset, New York

Visit Website

mercyFirst honors the spirit of the Sisters of Mercy and the legacy of their Foundress, Catherine McAuley, providing hope by reaching out to children and families in need, recognizing the unconditional, God-given right of every person to heal and grow physically, spiritually, morally, intellectually and emotionally.
